meta_prompts.description: Develop a comprehensive suite of tools for a data scientist. Focus on data cleaning, transformation, statistical analysis, and simple visualization preparation. Tools should be modular and reusable for a standard data analysis pipeline.

Act as a creative writing assistant. Develop tools for generating story ideas, creating character profiles, writing plot outlines, generating descriptive sentences, and checking for common grammar mistakes. These tools should be LLM-based and focus on creativity.

Build a toolkit for aiding software developers. Create tools that generate boilerplate code for common web frameworks, write unit tests for functions, translate code snippets between languages (e.g., Python to JavaScript), and generate documentation from code. This will heavily rely on LLM capabilities.

Design a set of tools for advanced file system management. Focus on tasks like finding duplicate files, organizing files into folders based on rules (e.g., by date, type, or name), batch renaming files, and compressing/decompressing archives.

Create a collection of tools for text analysis and natural language processing. Build tools for sentiment analysis, keyword extraction, text summarization, and identifying named entities from a given text.

Simulate a research assistant. Develop LLM-based tools to find academic papers on a given topic, summarize research articles, generate a literature review outline from a list of papers, and format citations in common academic styles (e.g., APA, MLA).

Develop a basic toolkit for image processing. Create tools to resize images, convert image formats (e.g., PNG to JPEG), apply simple filters (e.g., grayscale, blur), and extract image metadata like dimensions and creation date.

Build a set of tools for managing personal finances. Focus on tools that can categorize expenses from a list of transactions, calculate loan payments, create a simple budget based on income and expenses, and track investment performance.

Create tools to facilitate web scraping. Develop utilities for fetching HTML content from a URL, parsing HTML to extract specific data (like tables or links), and saving the extracted data to a structured format like CSV or JSON.

Construct tools for running simple simulations. Build a tool to simulate dice rolls, a basic population growth model (e.g., logistic map), and a simple physics simulation like projectile motion. The tools should be configurable and return structured results.
